text: Hashkey Cloud closed won! :tada:
Pier Two closed won! :partyparrot:

Hey BD team!

Previously I modeled that our credentials will stop becoming unprofitable after 25-30 issuances.

We're now at 21, and I can tell you, we've hit that point. Our profitability has slid from $7.5k/day to $2.5k/day

elements.text:
Hey BD team!

Previously I modeled that our credentials will stop becoming unprofitable after 25-30 issuances.

We're now at 21, and I can tell you, we've hit that point. Our profitability has slid from $7.5k/day to $2.5k/day

text:
Let's keep moving deals forward in the sales process, but stop issuing credentials for now.

We can just tell everyone we're pausing temporarily, while we move to a system that has less fixed fees, resulting in greater rewards. We'll pass the savings onto the customers

text: Still good to develop as many deals as possible, and to identify potential Minters also. That'll come in handy later

elements.text: Still good to develop as many deals as possible, and to identify potential Minters also. That'll come in handy later

text: Ah wait, Jesse told me, the reward drop could be due to a bug in the Utility app. 5 credentials are not billing correctly. We're figuring it out.. hold for more info

elements.text: Ah wait, Jesse told me, the reward drop could be due to a bug in the Utility app. 5 credentials are not billing correctly. We're figuring it out.. hold for more info

text:
Hey all! Good news: turns out, 5 customers were not billing due to a software issue. (FiveNorth, Foundinals, Node Monster, Republic, Maestro)

That resets the math.  At 16 credentials issued (not 21), our profit is $2.65/block/customer ($6k/day).  So, not bad.

In this case, we should keep selling new creds. It's still good business, and it'll balloon once we lower the $5 cost

Let's get em team! :fire:

Let's get em team!

text: incredible!!
the race is on!!!!!

Just a heads up <@U05FZBDQ4RJ>, regarding your answer here:
<https://bit-safe.slack.com/archives/C094F9AUCRJ/p1752736789542799?thread_ts=1752710829.860719&cid=C094F9AUCRJ>

> Nothing needs to be installed on your side.
This is not true for minters. In our current design, Minters would need to upload the DARs and launch the dApp UI to actually mint/burn.

Maybe in future iterations this could be avoided, but there is no easy way to do this yet on Canton

elements.text: Hi Ivan - jumping in for Addie here, while she's asleep.
Yes, to mint CBTC, you need to have BTC. CBTC is a bridged/wrapped Bitcoin

Nothing needs to be installed on your side. Within weeks, we're launching our app on Canton. We'll create a login for you. When you log in and mint, it'll generate a BTC deposit address. You can send BTC there from any wallet/custodian
Right now, CantonCoin can only be traded via OTC (Cumberland). In the future, you'll be able to swap CC for CBTC, or any other asset, via CEX or DEX

attachments.fallback:
[July 17th, 2025 12:19 AM] aki: Hi Ivan - jumping in for Addie here, while she's asleep.

1. Yes, to mint CBTC, you need to have BTC. CBTC is a bridged/wrapped Bitcoin
2. Nothing needs to be installed on your side. Within weeks, we're launching our app on Canton. We'll create a login for you. When you log in and mint, it'll generate a BTC deposit address. You can send BTC there from any wallet/custodian
3. Right now, CantonCoin can only be traded via OTC (Cumberland). In the future, you'll be able to swap CC for CBTC, or any other asset, via CEX or DEX
attachments.text:
Hi Ivan - jumping in for Addie here, while she's asleep.

1. Yes, to mint CBTC, you need to have BTC. CBTC is a bridged/wrapped Bitcoin
2. Nothing needs to be installed on your side. Within weeks, we're launching our app on Canton. We'll create a login for you. When you log in and mint, it'll generate a BTC deposit address. You can send BTC there from any wallet/custodian
3. Right now, CantonCoin can only be traded via OTC (Cumberland). In the future, you'll be able to swap CC for CBTC, or any other asset, via CEX or DEX

elements.text: Nothing needs to be installed on your side.

This is not true for minters. In our current design, Minters would need to upload the DARs and launch the dApp UI to actually mint/burn.

Maybe in future iterations this could be avoided, but there is no easy way to do this yet on Canton

text: Unless, we actually host their party on our Validator, which you do allude to this actually with "We'll create a login for you." . This is a viable path, but then they have to trust our node for keeping their data/access stable and secure

elements.text: Unless, we actually host their party on our Validator, which you do allude to this actually with "We'll create a login for you." . This is a viable path, but then they have to trust our node for keeping their data/access stable and secure

text:
Sidenote, but Fairmint is quite shamelessly farming in the open :smile: <https://www.cantonscan.com/search/12204a039322c01e9f714b56259c3e68b69058bf5dfe1debbe956c698f905ceba9d7>
Their validator hosts 85 parties, whose balances look exactly like this, just a deposit, and a slow spend to 0, earning their receiver app rewards.
I wonder how the GSF will deal with this
